metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12188 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
arch/x86/kvm/mmu.c in the Linux kernel through 4.13.5, when nestedvirtualisation is used, does not properly traverse guest pagetable entriesto resolve a guest virtual address, which allows L1 guest OS users toexecute arbitrary code on the host OS or cause a denial of service(incorrect index during page walking, and host OS crash), aka an "MMUpotential stack buffer overrun."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.10.0-40-generic - 4.10.0-40.44~16.04.1
linux-image-4.10.0-40-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-40.44~16.04.1
linux-image-4.10.0-40-lowlatency - 4.10.0-40.44~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-40-generic - 4.10.0-40.44~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1009-gcp - 4.10.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1009-gcp - 4.10.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1015.15').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1009.9').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
